resource.chars:
<u>No. 6<\u>
'Discovery'
Winter Quarters Feb 26th 1903
Sir
I have the honour to acknowledge the receipt 
of the Presidents' letter dated July 4th 1902 despatched 
by the 'Morning'
Owing to the experience of last year, on my return 
from sledging I confidently expected that by this time 
the ships would be in easy communication 
This hope has unfortunately not been fulfilled and the 
arrangements connected with <s>these<\s> such an unexpected circumstance<s>s<\s> 
have so fully occupied my time that I am wholly 
unable to reply to the presidents letter at any length 
and must confine myself to despatching this letter 
with the following enclosures 
1. Description of the ship's position
2. Brief summary of proceedings 
3. List of men discharged to Morning <s>with Dr Koettlitz's report<\s> 
4. List of <s>stores required for<\s> men remaining on ship 
5. List of stores required next year.
In regard t<s>he<\s>o the men remaining in the ship, should she 
be detained another winter, I would earnestly beg 
the Presidents to request the Admiralty that <s>they<\s> their service prospects may 
in no manner suffer by their prolonged absence 
All these men have elected to stand by the ship and 
are now fully alive to the prospects they must face 
in so doing
